answers.answer: "Can it be the diabetes or just because I am for long hours on my feet."We cannot rule out diabetes neuropathy since you didn't tell us how well you are managing your glucose levels. Do you test at home and what are your fasting [preprandial] and 2-3 hours after meal [postprandial] levels? What was your last A1c result?You might consider seeing a Rheumatologist, a joint specialist, to rule out arthritis, bursitis, or other inflammation and/or nerve damage caused by constant standing. JMO.

question: I was diagnosed with diabetes a few years ago. T he job what I do is a 12 hour 7 days a week job and I am on my feet most of the time. For the past year I find that I have been getting a hot tingling pain in both of my legs just above the knee. Can it be the diabetes or just because I am for long hours on my feet. As soon as I sit down the pain goes away.
